summary: This document is an email from July 18, 2021, forwarding two FedEx records (PDFs) related to the Epstein case. The email notes that one package was sent to a person identified as 'her' and references the recipient's appearance in the documents under a specific name before an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Mentioned as the recipient or associated office for the FedEx package records being discussed. The specific name is not provided in the visible text.

events.title: Email Forwarding FedEx Records
events.description: An email was sent forwarding two PDF files containing FedEx records. One record shows a package sent to an unidentified female recipient, with her name appearing on specific pages of the documents.

locations.context: Location of the United States Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, referenced as the associated office for the recipient of the correspondence or records.

keyFacts: Two FedEx records (PDFs) were identified and forwarded via email on July 18, 2021.
One FedEx package was sent to an unidentified female recipient ('her'), with her name appearing on page 5 of the first PDF and page 8 of the second PDF.
The records were associated with or sent to the United States Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York at One St. Andrew's Plaza.
The email suggests these records were part of an investigative or legal process, possibly flagged as significant ('hot').
